text: Dasun Pathirana (born 26 July 1985, as දසුන් පතිරණ) [Sinhala]), is a model and an award-winning actor in Sri Lankan cinema, theater and television. He won an award at Indie Fest 2014 as best actor in a leading role. He received his first Sarasaviya award in 2018. ==Early life== Pathirana studied in Carey College, Colombo. He studied drama and acting under Mahendra Perea's academy of acting and drama. == Personal life == Dasun's partner is Nadeesha Hansi Dissanayake and their love story had been a secret to the media for four years. The two has two daughters, Shaiya Lily Pathirana, born in 2018 and Shaya Lily Pathirana , born in 2019 ==Career== Pathirana started his career in 2002 at the age of 17. In 2004, Pathirana entered Mahendra Perera’s Academy for Acting and Drama. He performed in many Sri Lankan teledramas,"Empty spaces in Star Reality Shows". By Susitha R. Fernando films, commercials, stage dramas"Theatre for the young". Daily News, 1 December 2010, R S Godage and music videos. He received a Best Upcoming Actor award for his role in the teledrama Ahasin Watuna."Nominations for Raigam Tele’es". The Sunday Times. In 2014, he was the lead in the film Frangipani,"The rainbow of Sayapethi Kusuma". Daily Mirror, 2017-01-02. Gamini Akmeemana. which screened at Tasveer, the ninth Annual Seattle South Asian Film Festival"Tasveer: 9th Seattle South Asian Film Festival returns". International Examiner, Yayoi Lena Winfrey 21 October 2014 and at the BFI Flare LGBT Film Festival."‘Frangipani’ review – Life with more than just two petals…". Asian Culture Vulture. 12 April 2015"Frangipani – BFI Flare 2015 Review". One Room with a View, Danielle Davenport 25 March 2015 His acting received positive reviews."Opening ourselves to Dialogue". The Nation. By Samantha Sirimanne Hyde, 25 April 2015. In 2015, he played the lead in Motor Bicycle, which won best film and best direction awards at the SAARC Film Festival. The film also won the "Cinema of tomorrow" award at the Derana Film Award Ceremony in year 2015. He received the best actor award in Derana sunsilk cinema Awards 2017 for his role "Kasun" in movie Sayapethi Kusuma.
